posts.raw_content: The local Pajeet gas station down the street from me, had never really advertised taking EBT, until other pajeets bought the store a few months ago.  To be honest the guys that owned it before were actually okay. Decent fellows. But now they've got we accept EBT tagged everywhere on the property. They don't have much in there they can use EBT on. How do you get an investigation going on this? If anyone knows please let me know. Because something is rotten in Denmark. I think they're scamming the system.

posts.raw_content:
Upstate folks already feel like the city's a vampire on their neck-taxes flow down, 
nothing flows back.

    If Mamdani wins-and yeah, he's polling strong-he'll push Albany for billions in 

state matching funds: free buses, day care, rent caps, grocery co-ops. Doesn't 

matter if he calls it democratic socialism, it's still math.

   NYC already gulps thirty-five percent of its budget from Albany; add his wishlist 

and the bill gets mailed to Syracuse, Buffalo, the dairy farms in Chautauqua. So 

what can upstate do besides grumble? 

**Here's the playbook, from polite to full apocalypse.**

----------------------


1. Starve the Beast-vote and lobby like hell Push for a regional equity commission 

next session. Make it law that every dollar spent in NYC gets audited against 

upstate returns-publish the numbers every quarter. Shame works. Upstate senators 

like Borrello and Ortt have floated this before; threaten to kill any budget without it. 

Meanwhile, Farm Bureau, Chamber of Commerce, even the craft breweries in the 

Catskills-form a coalition. Call it Keep New York Rural. Flood Albany with postcards: 

Why's my cow paying for the subway? 

-----------------------

2. Legal trench warfare File suit the second he asks for extra state cash. Claim it 

violates equal-protection-say it's urban favoritism baked into the constitution. You 

have three years to challenge tax formulas; start the clock now. Also push a ballot 

initiative: Upstate Homestead Exemption-slash property taxes twenty percent for 

farms and small businesses, funded by clawing back NYC aid. Takes signatures, but 

it's cleaner than secession and still stings. 

----------------------

3. Exodus 2.0-make it hurt NYC loses a billionaire a month already; speed it up. 

Upstate counties offer relocation rebates-ten years zero property tax for any firm 

leaving the five boroughs. Buffalo's got space, cheap hydro power, and no 

congestion tax. Advertise on Wall Street elevators: Escape Manhattan, keep your 

money. The second Citigroup or Goldman packs up, the city's own revenue craters. 

Mamdani wants Robin Hood? Let him rob an empty castle. 

----------------------

4. Nuclear options-split the state or shut it down Dust off Divide NY: three zones-

North Country/New Amsterdam (upstate), New York (city), Montauk (Long Island). 

Separate taxes, separate governors, same federal reps. Hawley's bill is ready; just 

needs a referendum. Or go smaller: counties opt-out clause. If sixty percent vote 

yes, they can secede from state programs-like Massachusetts with its local-option 

tax revolt in the eighties. Extreme? Sure. But imagine Cortland County saying, We 

keep our sales tax, you keep your free buses. 

----------------------

5. Quiet non-compliance-slow-walk the money. Counties can delay tax remittances-

thirty days here, sixty there-while auditing compliance. Not illegal, just bureaucratic 

hell. Or pass local ordinances capping how much of your sales tax goes to Albany. 

  The state's never sued a county for that; too many in on it. Think of it as a soft tax 

strike. Farmers could forget to file quarterly-penalties sting, but if enough do it, the 

system jams. 

....

* Bonus: weaponize the narrative Mamdani wants optics-free stuff for the poor. Give 

him counter-optics. Drone footage of empty Wall Street streets, farms padlocked 

because taxes spiked. Tag it #commieRobsUpstate. He'll look like a bully 

ransacking the countryside while handing out tokens in the city. Voters hate that. 

Even some Bronx moms will side with a dairy farmer if she sees his kids can't afford 

shoes. Bottom line: don't wait. Start the coalition now. If he wins, the fight's already 

half lost. But upstate's got land, water, votes in the Senate, and a memory longer 

than his mandate. Make him regret every free bus he ever let the homeless live on.
posts.author: MAGALADON9
posts.title: **** -- THE COMING WAR IN N.Y.C.  - AND WHAT TO DO --****
posts.content:
Upstate folks already feel like the city's a vampire on their neck-taxes flow down, nothing flows back.

If Mamdani wins-and yeah, he's polling strong-he'll push Albany for billions in

state matching funds: free buses, day care, rent caps, grocery co-ops. Doesn't

matter if he calls it democratic socialism, it's still math.

NYC already gulps thirty-five percent of its budget from Albany; add his wishlist

and the bill gets mailed to Syracuse, Buffalo, the dairy farms in Chautauqua. So

what can upstate do besides grumble?

Here's the playbook, from polite to full apocalypse.

  1. Starve the Beast-vote and lobby like hell Push for a regional equity commission

next session. Make it law that every dollar spent in NYC gets audited against

upstate returns-publish the numbers every quarter. Shame works. Upstate senators

like Borrello and Ortt have floated this before; threaten to kill any budget without it.

Meanwhile, Farm Bureau, Chamber of Commerce, even the craft breweries in the

Catskills-form a coalition. Call it Keep New York Rural. Flood Albany with postcards:

Why's my cow paying for the subway?

  1. Legal trench warfare File suit the second he asks for extra state cash. Claim it

violates equal-protection-say it's urban favoritism baked into the constitution. You

have three years to challenge tax formulas; start the clock now. Also push a ballot

initiative: Upstate Homestead Exemption-slash property taxes twenty percent for

farms and small businesses, funded by clawing back NYC aid. Takes signatures, but

it's cleaner than secession and still stings.

  1. Exodus 2.0-make it hurt NYC loses a billionaire a month already; speed it up.

Upstate counties offer relocation rebates-ten years zero property tax for any firm

leaving the five boroughs. Buffalo's got space, cheap hydro power, and no

congestion tax. Advertise on Wall Street elevators: Escape Manhattan, keep your

money. The second Citigroup or Goldman packs up, the city's own revenue craters.

Mamdani wants Robin Hood? Let him rob an empty castle.

  1. Nuclear options-split the state or shut it down Dust off Divide NY: three zones-

North Country/New Amsterdam (upstate), New York (city), Montauk (Long Island).

Separate taxes, separate governors, same federal reps. Hawley's bill is ready; just

needs a referendum. Or go smaller: counties opt-out clause. If sixty percent vote

yes, they can secede from state programs-like Massachusetts with its local-option

tax revolt in the eighties. Extreme? Sure. But imagine Cortland County saying, We

keep our sales tax, you keep your free buses.

  1. Quiet non-compliance-slow-walk the money. Counties can delay tax remittances-

thirty days here, sixty there-while auditing compliance. Not illegal, just bureaucratic

hell. Or pass local ordinances capping how much of your sales tax goes to Albany.

The state's never sued a county for that; too many in on it. Think of it as a soft tax

strike. Farmers could forget to file quarterly-penalties sting, but if enough do it, the

system jams.

....

  • Bonus: weaponize the narrative Mamdani wants optics-free stuff for the poor. Give

him counter-optics. Drone footage of empty Wall Street streets, farms padlocked

because taxes spiked. Tag it #commieRobsUpstate. He'll look like a bully

ransacking the countryside while handing out tokens in the city. Voters hate that.

Even some Bronx moms will side with a dairy farmer if she sees his kids can't afford

shoes. Bottom line: don't wait. Start the coalition now. If he wins, the fight's already

half lost. But upstate's got land, water, votes in the Senate, and a memory longer

than his mandate. Make him regret every free bus he ever let the homeless live on.
